content.rendered:
Certification closes October 31, 2022

The USGBC licensed LEED® to CAGBC to adapt and create LEED Canada, a version tailored for the Canadian market. Today, registration for LEED Canada is closed. All new projects must register under LEED v4. Projects currently registered under LEED Canada must submit for certification by October 31, 2022 or move to LEED v4.

Minimum Program Requirements (MPRs)

The MPRs list the basic characteristics that a project must meet to be eligible for certification under the LEED Canada rating systems. The MPR document helps guide Canadian projects to determine if the scope of their project is appropriate for certification: it provides direction for specific situations; establishes exceptions; and describes the intent behind each requirement.

MPRs are mandatory for all projects registered on or after September 2012 and supersede the MPRs noted in the LEED Canada Reference Guide for Green Building Design and Construction 2009. All projects required to follow the MPRs must provide a signed MPR form with their project submission, declaring the project meets all MPRs or allowed exceptions. Projects registered earlier are strongly encouraged to adopt guidance from these MPRs and their documented exceptions for greater clarity on project scope issues.

Download the Minimum Program Requirements (MPRs) for LEED Canada Rating Systems (pdf)

LEED Canada pricing 

The LEED Canada certification fee is based on your project’s rating system and size, and when calculated and paid, documentation is submitted for review. Certification fees are calculated using the Certification fee submittal form, which must be completed and enclosed with payment. Certification fees are not refundable and may change at any time. 

To be eligible for member discounts on certification fees, the organization that owns the building (or which occupies the space, in the case of commercial interiors) must be a current CAGBC Specialist member. Other discounts are available for governments and not-for-profits. Some exceptions apply, so contact us for more information.

Download the LEED pricing sheet

LEED Canada Credit Interpretation Requests

Project teams with questions about applying a LEED prerequisite or credit to a specific registered project can submit enquiries to CAGBC. The Credit Interpretation Requests (CIRs) are clarifications, not new requirements and apply to all projects that are not yet certified. A database of CIRs is available to all CAGBC members and the main contact for any registered project. 

ACCESS CIR DATABASE

LEED Canada rating systems & resources

New Construction and Core and Shell

The LEED Canada NC rating system applies to new construction and major renovations of commercial and institutional buildings regulated by Part 3 of the National Building Code. It also applies to retail, mid- and high-rise multi-unit residential buildings (MURBs), public assembly buildings, manufacturing plants, and other types of buildings.

LEED Canada CS applies to buildings where the owner controls 50% or less of the building area that will be fit-up to LEED Canada NC requirements prior to certification.

Rating system & reference guide

LEED Canada NC 2009 and LEED Canada CS 2009

LEED Canada NC 2009 and LEED Canada CS 2009 Rating System

Additional information

Average Scorecard for LEED Canada-NC 2009

Toronto LEED Supplement

Commercial Interiors

The LEED Canada-CI rating system is applicable to tenant improvements of new or existing office space. LEED Canada-CI applies to both tenants’ and base building owner’s work associated with the commercial interiors improvements project. 

Rating System and Reference Guide

LEED Canada-CI Rating System

Average Scorecard for LEED Canada-CI

Homes 

Residential projects ranging from single family homes to multi-family buildings of up to three residential storeys can take advantage of the LEED® Canada for Homes program.

Rating System and Reference Guide

Learn More

Questions? Contact us

Call toll-free: (866) 941-1184 or email us.
